intro: Centaurea nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pinkish flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray and disk flowers, which attract various pollinators. Centaurea nuttallii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid environments.
